DAG (diacylglycerol) is a signaling molecule that plays a crucial role in the production of sperm in the testes. It activates protein kinase C (PKC), which in turn stimulates the interstitial cells to produce testosterone, a hormone necessary for sperm production. If DAG fails to activate PKC in the R-cells (cells that produce DAG), then the interstitial cells will not produce enough testosterone, leading to a decrease in sperm production.
